citation.article-title: Shinella yambaruensis sp. nov., a 3-methyl-sulfolane-assimilating bacterium isolated from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Shinella An et al. 2006
Shinella (Shi.nel′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Shinella named after Yong-Kook Shin, for his contributions to the reclassification of the genus Zoogloea).
The description is as given by An et al. (2006), with the following changes.
Cells are motile or non-motile rods.
Most strains form an amorphous or finger-like floc in liquid media, but flocculation is not observed in the type strain of S. yambaruensis.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and C19 : 1; a trace amount of the hydroxy fatty acid C16 : 0 3-OH is also detected.
